author: E. Marcel Pourtout mpourtout@neighbornewspapers.com (noreply@roswellneighbor.com)
title: Football season heads toward conclusion
text: Football season heads toward conclusion by E. Marcel Pourtout October 21, 2015 02:15 PM | 240 views | 0 | | Special/ William LoftonSpecial / William Lofton Chattahoochee senior Isaiah Sayles (14) tackled by several Cherokee defenders in contest earlier this season. slideshow Milton won its second game of the season last Friday with a 28-21 road victory over Cherokee. Cameron Adams rushed for a team-high 181 yards in the Eagles’ victory. His 51-yard touchdown run with 6:28 left in the contest was the game-winning scored. Overall, Milton ran for 244 yards as a team.“The key to the Cherokee win was the consistency of the offense and very good special teams,” Milton coach Howie DeCristofaro said. “We were able to sustain drives and keep penalties to a minimum. Defensively we slowed down their running back just enough to win.”Milton next contest will be a home contest against Walton this Friday. The visiting Raiders are coming off of a 49-21 win last week over Woodstock and have a 7-1 record on the season. “Walton can run and throw with equal success,” DeCristofaro said. “We must stop the run and force them to do the things that put us in a position to win. We must turn the ball over and we must keep the penalties from occurring.”Walton leads the lifetime series over Milton 13-5 however the Eagles have won the past two contests including last season’s 20-17 victory.Blessed Trinity stayed undefeated on the season with a 24-10 at Westminster last Friday. Milton Shelton rushed for 173 yards and intercepted a pass on defense. Conor Davis threw for 114 yards and a touchdown. Blessed Trinity held its opponent to only 74 yards of rushing. The Titans are now 7-0 this season and won 20 of their last 21 contests dating back to last season.Blessed Trinity hosts Washington (Atlanta) this Friday. The Titans won last season’s contest 36-6.Roswell also kept its perfect record intact last Friday, defeating Pope 52-0 at home, pushing its record to 7-0. Sheldon Evans rushed for 151 yards and two touchdowns while A.J. Smith caught four passes for 126 yards and a touchdown. Hornets’ quarterback Quintarius Neely threw three touchdown passes.Next up for Roswell will be a road tilt at Woodstock this Friday. The Hornets hold a 7-2 lifetime series lead over the Wolverines, winning last year’s game 49-38. Woodstock has a 4-4 record this season.Alpharetta earned a 49-39 home win over Chattahoochee in a Region 6- battle, improving the Raiders record to 4-3 on the season while the Cougars fell to 0-7. Alpharetta scored on seven of its nine offensive possessions, racking up a school-record 604 total yards. Matthew Downing threw for 348 yards and five touchdowns, while rushing for another score. Wide receiver Darryl Bivens had seven catches for 149 yards and three touchdowns while Nolan Edmonds ran for 157 yards and a touchdown for the Raiders.Chase Owens threw for 243 yards and touchdown for Chattahoochee and Bryce Cross returned an interception for a score.Alpharetta will visit South Forsyth in Cumming this Friday. The Raiders have won all five previous meeting between the two schools, winning last season’s contest 24-14. South Forsyth is 6-1 on the season but lost its first game of the year last week at West Forsyth 38-34. “South Forsyth is a great football team,” Alpharetta coach Jacob Nichols said. “It will take a great effort for us to win, but I believe we are up to the challenge. Our postseason chances are on the line, so we will be putting it all on the line from this point forward.”Chattahoochee looks for its first win of the season this Friday at Northview which has a record of 3-4. The Cougars hold a 6-3 lifetime series lead over the Titans but lost last year’s contest 37-7.Behind 340 yards passing and three touchdowns from Casen Conway, Centennial extended its winning streak to four games with a 42-35 home win at Habersham Central last Friday. Caden Herring also returned a kickoff 95 yards for the Knights.Centennial brings its 4-3 record into a home contest against North Forsyth (1-6) this Friday. “North Forsyth is a really good football team,” Knights’ coach Lenny Gregory said. “We will need to play physical and be very sound with our fundamentals.”Cambridge improved its record to 6-1 this year with a 35-19 road win at North Springs last Friday. The Bears ran for 278 yards led by Kaelin Byrd’s game-high 154 yards. JD White had two rushing scores as well. This Friday,Cambridge travels to Atlanta and faces Riverwood who is 6-2 this season.“Riverwood has some tremendous players on offense and defense,” Bears’ coach Craig Bennett said. “We will have to play a complete game offensively, defensively and on special teams.”Other matchups this week include King’s Ridge hosting Mount Pisgah, Whitefield Academy visiting St. Francis and Fellowship Christian on the road at Pinecrest Academy.
